segments.text: I see the water running over the edge of the sink, and it’s just getting worse.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is still drying that plate like it’s the only thing that matters.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is standing on that stool, and it’s about to tip over any second now.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just watching, waiting for her cookie, like nothing is wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how unaware the woman is of everything around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just pouring onto the floor, and she doesn’t even seem to notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is reaching into the cookie jar, and the stool is so unstable.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I need to warn them before someone gets hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman’s foot is in the puddle, but she’s just standing there, drying dishes.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful compared to the chaos inside.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think someone needs to turn off the water before it’s too late.
segments.speaker: PAR
